Typedef Documentation

typedef enum _NITF_CLEVEL NITF_CLEVEL

This file makes it easy to compute and recompute the CLEVEL. It only works on 2.1 files, not on legacy 2.0.

Function Documentation

NITF_CLEVEL nitf_ComplexityLevel_get ( nitf_Record *  record  ) 

Get the CLEVEL as recorded in the file

Returns:
The CLEVEL, unknown if not 03,05,06,07 or 09

NITF_CLEVEL nitf_ComplexityLevel_measure ( nitf_Record *  record,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

This function attempts to measure the CLEVEL of a NITF 2.1 record. The record should be populated with all of the meta-data, so that it can be measured.

This function is 'class-static' in the sense that we provide no ComplexityLevel class publicly. Internally, its represented as a set of function pointers that act on the nitf_Record.

This API call is new for 2.5. As of 2.5, the Writer will also use this function internally to checking if a Record's complexity level has not yet been set, and if not, it will attempt to auto-calculate it.

Parameters:
record The input record (its clevel is not modified for this op)
error [output] Contains an error if one exists (in which case the return value will be NITF_CLEVEL_CHECK_FAILED
Returns:
A clevel if determined, NITF_CLEVEL_CHECK_FAILED on error

NITF_BOOL nitf_ComplexityLevel_toString ( NITF_CLEVEL  clevel,
char *  c2 
)

Turn the enumeration into a 2-byte char. This function should probably be renamed to toArray, since it does not write any NULL byte at the end (just a memcpy of 2 bytes)
